IN.IC: je oblika za sedanjik, preteklik in pretekli deležnik.

sense.def:
To shut something
pomeni nekaj premakniti, tako da ni več odprto.

seg.quote: He goes in and the door shuts behind him.

sense.def:
To shut one's eyes
pomeni povesiti veke, tako da ne vidimo ničesar.

seg.quote: Mrs Kaul shut her eyes for a moment.
He lay with his eyes shut.

sense.def:
To shut one's mouth
pomeni stisniti ustnici skupaj, tako da usta niso odprta.

seg.quote: Mr Boggis opened his mouth, then quickly shut it again.

sense.def:
Kadar trgovina, podjetje ali ustanova
shuts
, je zaprta, tako da ne moremo priti vanjo, dokler se spet ne odpre.

seg.quote: ‘What time do the shops shut?’—‘Half past five.’
The troops forced merchants to shut their shops.
I'm afraid all the pubs will be shut.

sense.def:
To shut something away
pomeni nekaj shraniti nekam, kjer ljudje tistega ne morejo videti.

cit.quote: hraniti pod ključem, umakniti pred javnostjo

seg.quote: We have a small number of books which are shut away.

sense.def:
Kadar tovarna ali podjetje
is shut down
, neha delati.

seg.quote: His department was shut down for lack of funds.
That year my grandfather had to shut down the forge.

sense.def:
To shut someone or something out
pomeni preprečiti, da bi nekdo ali nekaj prišlo v določen prostor.

seg.quote: They had covered the holes to shut out the water.

sense.def:
To shut out a thought or a feeling
pomeni prisiliti se, da ne mislimo na nekaj.

cit.quote: ne misliti na, pregnati misel na

seg.quote: She found it impossible to shut out the pain.

sense.def:
To shut up
pomeni nehati govoriti.

To shut someone up
pomeni preprečiti nekomu, da bi še naprej govoril;

seg.quote: Turn the television on. That usually shuts them up.
